content.question: A <math alttext="15.0 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> initially at <math alttext="20.0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20.0</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> absorbs <math alttext="4.60 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.60</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></math> of heat. The final temperature of the <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is closest to which of the following? (Assume the specific heat capacity of <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is constant at <math alttext="4.18 joules per gram degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.18</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>g·°C</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>.)

choices.label: <math alttext="20.1 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20.1</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="36.5 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>36.5</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="73.4 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>73.4</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="93.4 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>93.4</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="93.4 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>93.4</mn><mo rspace="0em">°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
